Now families can receive curriculum recommendatons and choose what best fits their students. Families still receive grading service for quizzes and tests, report cards, transcriptions and diplomas."

properties.name: Amity Institute
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 3065 Rosecrans Place, San Diego CABased on the belief that cross-cultural interaction creates an effective, dynamic learning environment, Amity Institute sponsors international educators to teach in US schools. Amity provides opportunities for global educators to share their knowledge with students, schools and communities. Amity Institute currently sponsors several programs in the field of international educational exchange. Please click on the name of each program to learn more about what they have to offer. -Exchange Teacher Program -Intern Teacher Program

properties.name: Ananda College of Living Wisdom
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 14618 Tyler Foote Rd, Nevada City, CA 95959 Higher Education for Higher Consciousness Live and study in a unique liberal arts college set in a community ashram in the Sierra Nevada mountains of Northern California. Areas of study: Yoga Philosophy World Cultures & Consciousness The Small Communities Solution Dharmic Business & Leadership Inspirational Arts Directional Psychology & Healing Alternative Energy & Sustainable Living Education for Life As well as offering an A.A. and B.A. degree in Living Wisdom Studies, we offer Certificate programs in: -Education for Life Teacher Training -The Small Communities Solution -World Cultures Study Abroad

properties.name: Arbor Academy
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf  USAHome Education created for your child. Why choose independent study? It allows the parent and the student to design a program perfectly suited to the needs of the individual student. We Believe - Learning Should be Natural, Connected to the Learner Arbor Academy offers custom private school services to families seeking to educate their children at home. Uniquely adaptive, Arbor Academy\'s home study support service has the experience and expertise to simplify the Independent Study process for your family. We can assist new Independent Study families by assessing the learning styles and educational goals of each child; while also offering assistance in choosing or selections of, the best of the available curriculums and educational materials. We firmly believe in the parent\'s right to choose a program and implement curriculum that best adapts to their child. In accordance with this tenant, we support and welcome families of all faiths. All Arbor families may choose materials that reflect their beliefs or utilize secular materials alone; or find a happy combination to suit.

properties.name: Aspen Community School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 1199 Woody Creek, CO, 81656The Aspen Community School provides: · A strong academic program combined with a focus on the physical and emotional well being of the child · An integrated curriculum to teach children to become critical thinkers and make learning relevant to their lives · Intimate class size with a small student: teacher ratio · A K-8 student body maximum of 122 children · Team-taught learning centers that combine two classes (e.g. 1st and 2nd grades) and two teachers. Students and teachers alike benefit from multi-age and multi-year classrooms · Community Mentoring Programs featuring local artists and professionals who engage with students in unique project-based mentoring and in-service sessions · Teachers who are passionate and knowledgeable in their academic fields as well as committed coaches, counselors and outdoor leaders · Classrooms designed as warm, comfortable, safe and stimulating spaces for learning · A true community environment where students are called upon to contribute to the success of the community

properties.name: Cascade Canyon School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 2626 Sir Francis Drake Blvd. Fairfax CA "We are a small, independent, progressive, co-educational K-8 school serving families in Marin County from our campus in Fairfax, California. Since the school opened in 1981, we have dedicated ourselves to offering progressive education in a small, community-oriented setting. Our multi-age classes of no more than fifteen students, in combination with our balanced, integrated curriculum foster our students\' natural creativity and desire to learn."

properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Yucaipa, CA 92399 This school features: A fun year-long theme 2008-2009 school year: "Raiders of the Renaissance Minds," based on some of the greatest minds throughout history Daily parental involvement. properties.name: Diablo Valley School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf  2924 Clayton Road, Concord, CA 9451Diablo Valley School is a Sudbury model school in Contra Costa County, California. Our structure is based on the philosophy that young people are naturally engaged in the job of becoming capable adults. Our school is uniquely designed for learning how to become a strong, independent, articulate, responsible adult ready to thrive in today\'s changing world. Grades: Students ages 5 to 19 can attend. While we do not segregate students by age or any other characteristic, our students are in the traditional age ranges for kindergarten, elementary, middle, and high school.

properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 2112 Santa Barbara Street, Santa Barbara, CA 93105Fielding OFFERS. . . The only distributed learning PhD program in clinical psychology accredited by the American Psychological Association (APA) Organizational development programs ranked in the Top 3 by OD Practitioner The only online teaching certificate program that awards doctoral-level academic credit One of the two largest doctoral programs in adult development - along with Harvard University - according to The Society for Research in Adult Development ------------------------------------------------------------------- Fielding IS. . . The first university in California to offer a master’s degree concentration in Charter School Leadership The only graduate university to offer a PhD in media psychology One of the top 100 graduate degree producers in the nation for minority recipients (Diverse Issues in Higher Education July 2008) A community of self-directed, high-achieving professionals seeking an alternative to traditionally structured graduate programs

properties.name: Foundations School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 14646 Sherman Way, Van Nuys, CA 91405 "Foundations School Community is unique among Los Angeles private schools. As the only kindergarten, elementary and middle progressive school in the San Fernando Valley, our curriculum focuses on experienced-based learning in a caring, non-competitive setting that leads to academic, social and emotional success and happy, well-educated children. The success of our individually-based alternative education approach and low class size is demonstrated by the fact that our students continue to thrive academically at the top secondary schools in the area."

properties.name: Garden Gate Montessori
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 63 Sandy Ln, Walnut Creek, CA 94597Garden Gate is a home-based, part time only, mainly mornings program for families seeking something homey, beautiful, holistic, and personal for their children. Your child will flourish in one of our two integrated programs designed to meet the individual needs of every student. We offer a joyful and personalized educational experience for children from 2.75 through 6 years of age. ___________________________________________ Our Pre-primary Students form a community of 20 students of ages 3 to 6 years, with three Montessori teachers. Our Transition Group is a cozy group of 5 to 8 very young two morning students integrated with 4 and 5 day students from our Pre-primary Group, with one teacher to every five to seven students, as described in our "Morning Programs" page.

properties.name: Genesis Forum Academy
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf  2715 West Kettleman Lane"Genesis Forum Academy began as a Bible study on the book of Genesis, chapters 1-11, an outgrowth of a series of Sunday School classes in a local church fellowship. Gradually, a vision began to emerge for an academy program involving six specific ministries based on the Bible and Genesis as presented on the home page of this web site."

properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Ojai, CA 93024"Global Village School offers a progressive, accredited, customizable K-12 homeschooling program via online and text-based curriculum, complete with individualized teacher services. Our high school homeschool diploma courses integrate peace, justice, and diversity studies with the core subjects. We are an international school; we welcome students from around the globe. "

properties.name: Greenbriar School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Bastrop. TX"GreenBriar is an alternative community/School In Bastrop Texas. We have been in operation since March of 1969. But have only started trying to get the school part going again in the last couple years. Most of the students are between 8 and 12 but any age is welcome. For more information send a message or call at 281-2661 but you probably will get a message machine, so leave a message and some one will call you back."

properties.name: Headwater School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 139 Madison, Pettigrew, Arkansas 72752 Headwaters is a private non-profit school, with a one-room schoolhouse environment. Most day-students are registered as homeschoolers, and while parents are primarily responsible for their child\'s education, Headwaters provides support, facilities, and group activities that are otherwise not available to these children. Headwaters School is not just for homeschoolers. Homeshoolers, preschoolers, public school students, and friends participate freely in all school activities. Regular school meetings and events develop social skills and provide forums for peaceful conflict resolution and consensus building. We also sponsor community education programs providing everything from computer-based information management to Earth-living skills development. We continue to expand our educational network, and hope to continue to exchange students with other community schools around the world.

properties.name: Higher Ground Learning
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 325 West Pierpont Avenue, Salt Lake City, UT 84101 "Higher Ground Learning is a creative learning center for all ages, providing students with educational alternatives that stimulate the intellect and imagination. From one-on-one instruction to our workshops and classes, we specialize in innovative and experiential curricula, giving each student a chance to explore his or her interests, develop life skills, and experience the passion of learning. We are an organization of educators committed to creating a strategic plan for each student in order to foster intellectual growth. We specialize in individualized instruction in all subjects and we are successful for three main reasons: we are skilled instructors; we create a motivating and energetic learning environment; and we work attentively and compassionately as mentors to see our students succeed. "

properties.name: Holden High School,
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 10 Irwin Way, Orinda, California 94563"Holden High School’s mission is to provide a safe, supportive, and effective learning community for a broad spectrum of adolescents who thrive in a less traditional and more empowering educational environment. We help our students develop self-confidence, communication skills, a strong sense of community, and a lifelong love of learning. Since 1969, we have been committed to a student-centered approach that honors who students are and focuses on their academic, social, emotional, and creative needs. Our teaching and counseling staff work collaboratively with each family to foster the learning and growth that support students’ individual academic and personal goals."

properties.name: Houston Outdoor Learning Acadamy
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf  2731 Houston Ave., Houston, TX 77009"Houston Outdoor Learning Academy, or HOLA, is a full-time school for students in grades 6 through 12 who wish to combine their innate curiosity, love of the outdoors, and academic growth into an educational setting that uses a hands-on approach to enhance self-esteem, multiple intelligences, academic knowledge, social skills, and personal success. Our international expedition is the motivation and culmination of the year\'s studies. This year we are traveling to an exciting destination yet to be determined. Last year we went to VIETNAM!"

properties.name: Integral Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 8660 Gilman Drive, La Jolla, 92037"Integral Education is a philosophy and practice of education for the whole child: body, emotions, mind, soul, and spirit. The modern practice of education for utility or for productivity is not enough for the children of the 21st century. It ignores the highest and truest parts of their being. Too often it ignores the physical and emotional development of the child as well. Integral Education unites the ancient educational goal of self-knowledge with the modern goal of world-knowledge. Both of these goals are admirable, and the two of them must go hand-in-hand in any educational system that is integral..."

properties.name: Khabele School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 801 Rio Grande, Austin TX 78701"The Khabele School takes a holistic view of education. We believe that effective education is a process that should affect the whole person. Philosophically, we define and address 7 main facets of development. In practice, we recognize that these areas are essentially inter-related, and must be treated as such. The 7 areas addressed in Khabele education are academics, personal development, inter-personal development, creativity and the arts, physical education, finance and entrepreneurialism, and environmental stewardship."

properties.name: Kino Learning Center
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 6625 N. First Ave. Tucson, Arizona, 85718 What is "the Kino philosophy" ? An important, maybe the most important, idea underlying Kino\'s approach to education is the self-evident one that each child is a unique individual, with his or her own history, strengths, and needs. You can’t run a school based on a prearranged set of uniform policies and, at the same time, say that children are unique. I believe a school philosophy is limited and open-ended. It doesn’t cover everything; it doesn’t mandate everything; it doesn’t ban everything. It is a coherent set of basic beliefs that acts as a compass that guides our daily practice. It is a starting point. Educational philosophy should be open to new insights and understandings about how people learn, how the brain works, how society works, how the particular child works. This makes philosophy a work in progress, an evolving living body of thought, one that requires more effort and more communication.

properties.name: Learning Forum
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Oceanside, CA"Over the past 27 years, QLN\'s academic summer camp, youth programs, in-school and workshop programs in the areas of learning-and-life skills, teaching and training, and effective learning environments have become a leading resource for students, parents, teachers, school administrators and businesses. QLN President and co-founder, Bobbi DePorter\'s vision of schools, families, and businesses producing creative and responsible people ready to participate in a global community, has remained strong and continues to grow. "

properties.name: Open Doors Center
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Phoenix Open Doors is a private school in the Phoenix area. Our mission is to “Assist Beautiful Children Develop.” We welcome all children into our program including those children who are energetically and spiritually aware. These gifts may sometimes manifest in a way that society labels as Autism, ADHD, or Aspergers. We see these children who possess these qualities as gifted children, as all children are gifted. We are a K-8 service learning school. Thematic units are explored which culminate in a community service project. Mixed-age grouping provides a sense of community and allows for cooperative learning. Children learn through discovery as we come together to experience and expand in our wonderful, changing Universe. We strive to include the entire family in our Center. We believe that family and community connections are essential for growth.

properties.name: Pacific High School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 509 Lincoln St. Sitka, Alaska 99835 Pacific High School (PHS) is a place where youth find hope. Students who have become disenfranchised and disengaged in other school experiences give education one more chance when they apply to Sitka\'s alternative high school. PHS is in its 16th year of operation, and current enrollment is around 35 students.

properties.name: Prescott College
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 220 Grove Avenue, Prescott, AZ 86301 Prescott College is an independent, liberal arts college offering bachelor\'s and master\'s degrees, as well as teacher certification. Our educational programs reflect the College\'s commitment to the environment and social justice. Prescott College offers three programs for students of all ages and backgrounds. Students can live and study for an undergraduate degree in Prescott (Resident Degree Program), complete their undergraduate degree through our degree completion program (Adult Degree Program), earn their master\'s degree through our limited residency graduate program (Master of Arts Program), or pursue a Ph.D. in Education. Students can pursue a Teaching Certificate through any program

properties.name: School of Organic Education
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Marietta Drive, Fairhope, AlabamaWelcome to The Marietta Johnson School of Organic Education! In 2007 we celebrated our 100th year of continuous operation in the town of Fairhope, Alabama. Much has changed in those years. Our little town has transformed from a socialist experiment to a vacation destination. The tiny colony cottages made of native clay tiles have been replaced by grand homes. Subdivisions now spread out over what were once pecan orchards and potato fields. Our school campus has moved from the center of town to the outskirts. Technology has transformed the way in which we communicate and live. Despite all of these changes, the way children learn remains the same.

properties.name: Sego Lily School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 1533 E. Murray-Holladay Road, Salt Lake City, UT 84117"Sego Lily School is a private school where children ages 4-18 are free to pursue their individual interests while participating as responsible members of our democratic school community. Following our philosophy “Learning Through Living”, the school values all activities equally, and strives to create a community in which all people are honored for their unique gifts. Sego Lily School is modeled after the Sudbury Valley School in Framingham, Massachusetts, now celebrating their 40th anniversary."

properties.name: Steller Secondary School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 2508 Blueberry Street, Anchorage Alaska, 99503Steller Secondary School, a part of the Anchorage School District, offers an alternative to standard (large school) education. We have 300 students in grades 7-12 from the Anchorage area, all of whom attend the program by choice. The primary emphasis is on responsibility to self and to the Steller community. Students, parents, and staff participate in the democratic process of setting school policy and procedures.

properties.name: Teton Valley Community School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 192 West Birch Street Victor, ID 83455 "The Teton Valley Community School (TVCS) is a non-profit independent school that serves pre-K through 6th grade students and provides an educational alternative with small student-teacher ratios, multi-aged classrooms, and a progressive curriculum. Place-based thematic units provide the cornerstone for learning using real world experiences, personal and group responsibility, and community collaboration. Strong emphasis is placed on math and language arts skills, which are integrated into all aspects of the academic program. In addition, students participate in uniquely designed Spanish, music, art, and physical education programs taught by specialists in these fields...."

properties.name: The Center for Partnership Studies
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf  Pacific Grove, CA 93950The Center for Partnership Studies (CPS) is a 501c(3) nonprofit for public benefit corporation that conducts research and develops and disseminates education on the partnership model. It provides information and tools to promote the shift from domination to partnership in all aspects of society – from families and education to economics and politics. CPS is a member of the NGO (nongovernmental organization) section of the United Nations and supports the UN Millennial Goals.

properties.name: The Independent Institute
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf Oakland, CAThe mission of The Independent Institute is to transcend the all-too-common politicization and superficiality of public policy research and debate, redefine the debate over public issues, and foster new and effective directions for government reform. ....The resulting studies are published and widely distributed as books, articles in The Independent Review, Policy Reports, Working Papers, and other publications. Events sponsored by the Institute bring together scholars and policy experts to debate policy issues and discuss their implications. This work is conducted in conjunction with a series of educational centers...

properties.name: The Oaks School
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 6817 Franklin Ave. Hollywood, CA"It is a pleasure to invite you to browse our web pages. We hope you find that it gives you a feel of The Oaks School and all that we do. Since its founding in 1986, The Oaks has been a vibrant, creative community where mutual respect and compassion for one another are as important as stimulating intellectual pursuits. Our program includes strong homeroom classes supported by exciting special subjects, including Physical Education, Music, Art, Computers and Library. Parent involvement is highly encouraged. The student body, faculty, and staff are diverse individuals who share a common love of learning and caring for one another. We care to learn and learn to care together. We welcome you to visit us, so you can get a true sense of our school, located right in the middle of Hollywood."

properties.name: World Of Opportunity
properties.description: Posted by Shyanf 7429 Georgia Road Birmingham, AL 35212The WOO is a social justice and civil rights experiment which works at teaching the whole person. This means addressing hunger, homelessness, and domestic violence as well as academic needs. Over the past two years the WOO has worked with hundreds of pushed out students. Nine have passed the GED exam and others are about to take the exam. More than 100 students have used the WOO\'s training in computers, Health Care, and drafting to obtain jobs.
